head.title: Sorry, I Can't Help You: Phone Number Hell

hedline.hl1: Sorry, I Can't Help You: Phone Number Hell

abstract.p: Bebe T Ventura letter on tribulations of having telephone number similar one for New York University

block.p: I am suffering through an experience similar to that of Leslie Teicholz (''Egg Roll Revenge,'' Soapbox, March 1). I am suffering through an experience similar to that of Leslie Teicholz (''Egg Roll Revenge,'' Soapbox, March 1). Four years ago our phone company bestowed on all of New York University a new three-digit preface. My phone number is different by one digit from that of one graduate school. A publisher -- obviously without a college education -- listed my number in a guide.

The calls for N.Y.U. are constant on my phone from 9 A.M. to 6 P.M., sometimes 10 to 15 a day. At first, I politely offered the correct number. I then begged the deans, by letter and phone, to remedy the situation. To no avail. Then I refused to proffer the correction. No directory assistance service am I.

Ms. Teicholz has inspired me to diabolical heights. I have had my number for 28 years and am too fond of it to change, so, how to cope? I have had no marvelous opportunity to transfer my calls to a different restaurant, but my fertile imagination has been inspired.
BEBE T. VENTURA Upper East Side
